definition: to be certain of victory/to be bound to prevail
certainly/must/will/necessarily

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
Pizza Hut
an army burning with righteous indignation is bound to win (idiom)

sentences.english: We have a character of fortitude, a spirit of never being defeated, and a confidence of certain triumph.
sentences.chinese: 我们有着坚毅的性格，永不言败的精神和必胜的信心。

sentences.english: It’s easy to see an echo of that in blogosphere triumphalism.
sentences.chinese: 从博客世界中可以很容易看出对这一必胜信念的回应。

sentences.english: We can improve but we have the spirit to win.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以更好些，但我们有必胜的信念。

sentences.english: Gradually, I had to win the confidence of the people, want to repay the teacher of this pay.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐的，我有了必胜的信心，想回报老师的这份付出。

sentences.english: Simon: If it were up to me, I’d prefer to go to Pizza Hut.
sentences.chinese: 要是我说呀，我更愿意去必胜客餐厅。

sentences.english: The people will stop your profiteering schemes, and the people will win .
sentences.chinese: 人民将阻止你们牟取暴利的诡计，人民必胜。

sentences.english: Finally, believing that the nation was sure to win, the poet set up the flag of belief reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 诗人最终以民族必胜的信心扬起了信仰重构之旗。

sentences.english: If it were up to me, the toppings are much tastier at Pizza Hut.
sentences.chinese: 要是我说呀，必胜客的比萨浇头味道更好。

sentences.english: Lian: Ok, shall we go to Pizza Hut or Pizza Italia?
sentences.chinese: 那我们是去必胜客餐厅还是去比萨意大利餐厅？

sentences.english: The Chinese government has traditionally viewed Chinese IP theft as a win-win.
sentences.chinese: 所以通常中国政府会认定盗版商是必胜的。

sentences.english: Northwest corner of Huixin Dongqiao, Chaoyang, next to Pizza Hut.
sentences.chinese: 慧新东桥西北角，朝阳区，必胜客旁。

sentences.english: Our football team wins every time.
sentences.chinese: 我们的足球队每战必胜。

sentences.english: Laurie had great skill, dazzling grace, and a winning smile.
sentences.chinese: 劳利技巧娴熟，优雅无比，面带必胜的喜悦。

sentences.english: Sucess is the conviction to succeed at all costs!
sentences.chinese: 成功是一个必胜的决心和信念。

sentences.english: In the team can prevent the heaven, win.
sentences.chinese: 摩里支天能防官非，必胜法。

sentences.english: Daring to fight and win, scaled new heights of the vigorous spirit of fighting.
sentences.chinese: 敢打必胜，勇攀高峰的旺盛斗志。

definition: odds of success/stratagem that ensures success/to be sure of success
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
using the weak to defeat the strong (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to put one's all into the fight
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
powerful enemy
morale
to brave it out/to the bitter end
to underestimate the enemy
